segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just drying a plate, so focused on it like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she’s standing right in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned around yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little world, completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she realizes soon before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are right behind her, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a strange scene—everything feels so calm but so wrong at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR
